readme: General documentation covering major geopolitical and technological shifts in 2026, highlighting the divergence of AI sovereignty and the growth of decentralized networks.

items.headline: The Brussels Firewall: EU Finalizes 'Sovereign Core' AI Directive
items.body: The European Commission today ratified the Sovereign Core initiative, a multi-billion euro framework aimed at decoupling European critical infrastructure from Silicon Valley-dependent AI models. The directive mandates that all Tier-1 government services transition to locally hosted, open-weight architectures by 2027. Proponents argue this secures data privacy, while critics warn of a widening technological schism between the Atlantic powers.
items.flavor: Autonomy comes at a price, usually measured in gigawatts and latency.

items.headline: RE: Project Peregrine - Incident Report 404-B
items.body: Security audit confirms unauthorized exfiltration of the 'Atlas' weights from the Lagos R&D node. Preliminary traces suggest a state-sponsored actor utilizing a decentralized mesh-relay to bypass our geofencing. This breach compromises our competitive edge in low-bandwidth inference optimization. Immediate rotation of all neural keys is required. We suspect 'Silk-Road' corporate interests are the primary beneficiaries.
items.flavor: In the new scramble for Africa, the gold is weights, not minerals.

items.headline: #MeshNetRevolution: How Kinshasa Bypassed the Blackout
items.body: 1/5 The central grid went down, but the city stayed online. 2/5 Using recycled LoRa chips and the new 'Ubuntu-Link' protocol, we've built a decentralized backbone that doesn't care about fiber cuts. 3/5 Sovereign AI isn't just for rich nations; our local nodes are running crop-yield models right now. 4/5 No ISPs, no gatekeepers, just peer-to-peer resilience. 5/5 The digital divide is being bridged from the ground up. #DecentralizedAfrica #AIForAll
